docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 8-- President Johnson appears to have decided against any side trips or major tours of Latin America in connection with his April journey to a meeting of American chiefs of state in Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 8-- President Johnson appears to have decided against any side trips or major tours of Latin America in connection with his April journey to a meeting of American chiefs of state in Uruguay.

headline.main: Latin American Tour by Johnson Is Held Unlikely

byline.original: By MAX FRANKEL Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: One of South America's most distinguished soccer clubs, Cerro of Montevideo, Uruguay, will represent New York in the United Soccer Association (formerly the North American Soccer League), officials said yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: One of South America's most distinguished soccer clubs, Cerro of Montevideo, Uruguay, will represent New York in the United Soccer Association (formerly the North American Soccer League), officials said yesterday.
docs.abstract: N Amer League changes name to United Soccer Assn; Cerro Club (Montevideo, Uruguay) to be NY repr

headline.main: Cerro, Uruguayan Soccer Club, To Represent New York in Loop; Wolff President of Club Gabe Paul Heads Group

docs.snippet: Copper futures reacted bullishly to yesterday's announcement that President Johnson had asked Congress for immediate restoration of the 7 per cent investment tax credit. Traders also pointed to what they considered signs this week that the Government...
docs.lead_paragraph: Copper futures reacted bullishly to yesterday's announcement that President Johnson had asked Congress for immediate restoration of the 7 per cent investment tax credit. Traders also pointed to what they considered signs this week that the Government would pursue the war in Vietnam with vigor.

headline.main: WEATHER BUOYS WHEAT FUTURES; Quotations Show Strength on News of Dryness in Parts of Southwest

docs.snippet: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., March 11 Spring training in Florida for professional soccer players? Yes, sir.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., March 11 Spring training in Florida for professional soccer players? Yes, sir.

headline.main: Soccer Players Have Spring Training, Too; Generals Prepare to Win Friends and Influence People SPRING IS SEASON FOR SOCCER, ALSO

byline.original: By JAMES ROACH Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 11 Bolivia needs a navy like Switzerland does but Bolivia has admirals.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 11 Bolivia needs a navy like Switzerland does but Bolivia has admirals.

byline.original: By BARNARD L. COLLIER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 11 (AP) State Department officials said today that 37 nations had joined the United States in helping South Vietnam. Most are providing nonmilitary assistance, much of it minor.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 11 (AP) State Department officials said today that 37 nations had joined the United States in helping South Vietnam. Most are providing nonmilitary assistance, much of it minor.
docs.abstract: US State Dept says 37 nations join US in helping S Vietnam; most aid is nonmil, much of it minor; nations listed

headline.main: 37 Nations Join U.S. In Help to Vietnam, Mostly Nonmilitary
